paper_abstract: We present two versions of the Loomis-Sikorski Theorem, one for monotone sigma-complete generalized pseudo effect algebras with strong unit satisfying a kind of the Riesz decomposition property. The second one is for Dedekind sigma-complete positive pseudo Vitali spaces with strong unit. For any case we can find an appropriate system of nonnegative bounded functions forming an algebra of the given type with the operations defined by points that maps epimorphically onto the algebra.
paper_title: On two versions of the Loomis-Sikorski Theorem for algebraic structures
